context_of_use: This use case allows admins and power users to administer user accounts and perform related bulk operations within the system.
description: This use case enables admins and power users to manage user accounts and perform bulk operations effectively.
triggering_event: Admin or power user initiates the management of user accounts.
preconditions: Admin or power user is logged into the system.
User account management permissions are granted.
postconditions: Bulk operations are completed as requested.
assumptions: The system has a user account management feature.
Admins and power users have the necessary permissions to manage accounts.
requirements_met: The system shall allow admins to manage user accounts.
The system shall enable power users to handle bulk operations.
outstanding_issues: Clarification on the specific bulk operations allowed for power users.
main_flow: 1. Admin logs into the system → System verifies credentials and grants access.
2. Admin selects the option to manage user accounts → System displays user account management interface.
3. Admin performs actions on user accounts (e.g., create, update, delete) → System processes the actions and updates user accounts.
4. Power user logs into the system → System verifies credentials and grants access.
5. Power user selects the option to handle bulk operations → System displays bulk operation interface.
6. Power user performs bulk operations on user accounts → System processes the bulk operations and updates user accounts.
